documents.title: LEGO: Unified Prospects Checkout Features and Layout for Meal Brands
documents.content:
ï»¿LEGO: Unified Prospects Checkout Features and Layout for Meal Brands 1. Goal Our goal is to create a single, unified prospects checkout layout with standardized features that will work centrally for all Mealkit brands (HelloFresh, GreenChef, EveryPlate, and ChefsPlate) and RTE brands (Factor and Youfoodz).[a][b][c][d][e] Checkout is a critical phase in the acquisition funnel where users register or log in, provide their address, select delivery options, and add payment details. Unified feature is a shared component that can operate across multiple countries, brands, and user journeys. Once implemented, any new functionality built on this Feature is automatically available wherever the feature is deployed, ensuring consistency across the board. Features list are available on the portal: https://www-staging.hellofresh.com/features?f=DeliverySummaryFeature Modular checkout is the checkout code setup, which consists of independent, reusable unified Features. Checkout layout is a structure for how elements are interconnected as part of it. RTE - Ready-to-Eat Brands (Factor, Youufoodz) WLMK/New Mealkits - Mealkit brands (GreenChef, EveryPlate, and ChefsPlate) 2. Problem Statement The HelloFresh Group has expanded to 8 brands across 18 countries, which requires scalable solutions to avoid isolated work efforts. The prospects checkout process to purchase subscription can be identical across all brands and products, which makes it the first user experience that can be standardized and managed centrally. In January 2025, the activation user journey scope was transferred from TAM Alliance to Growth Alliance to centralize Checkout ownership within one team. Two brands, GoodChop and Pets Table, remain in TAM. Scope now increased to 31 distinct codes to manage (18 in HelloFresh with 6 in New Mealkits and 7 in RTE added on top). To scale further and grow sustainably, a strong foundation is needed. HelloFresh has set an 2025 objective #1 to accelerate product development velocity for Ready-to-eat (RTE) brands by distributing ownership of core customer journeys across the consumer-facing-alliances (CFAs). The Reduce Effort Needed to Checkout strategy initiated in 2024 involved refactoring the HelloFresh checkout into a modular checkout with unified features. By the end of 2024, the scope expanded to include RTE and WLML, aiming to unify features across all meal brands. More details are in Modular Checkout. The goal for H1-2025 is to complete feature modularization and unify the layouts for all meal brands. The new checkout layout will use the technical format that was created during the Single Page Checkout initiative. More details in Single Page Checkout: Experiment Results. Quick Status Overview (more details are in APPENDIX A [ROADMAP]) Checkout Features Rollout Statuses: Feature HF RTE (Factor & Youfoodz) & WLMK (GreenChef, EveryPlate, and ChefsPlate) Order Summary Feature âœ…Rolled out âœ…Rolled out Register Form Feature ğŸŸ£Experiment Re-Launch âœ…Rolled out Social Logins Feature ğŸŸ£Experiment Re-Launch âšªï¸ Neutral Results, No Rollout Address Form Feature âœ…Rolled out âœ…Rolled out Delivery Details Feature âœ…Rolled out Mobile âœ…Rolled out Mobile: Neutral Results Payment Methods âœ…Rolled out âœ…Rolled out Factor US Unified Layout - Lego Checkout âœ…Rolled out âœ…Rolled out 3. Impact of Modular Checkout Features and Shared Layout This initiative modularizes HelloFresh, RTE, and New Mealkits (GreenChef, Chefs Plate, Every Plate) Checkouts with Fe UFI-9680: Integrate with New Progress bar Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025 Remove invalid voucher from payload after first checkout attempt Use Control Logic * Remove Invalid voucher before making OPS call/query params UFI-9678 Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025 Redirect to plans page or register if not logged in or no plan selected Use Control Logic * Add check for logged-in user/cart-id and redirect UFI-9682: Add check for logged-in user/cart-id and redirect Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025 * UFI-9686: Add lego-checkout applanga group for caching Completed * UFI-9693: Check requirement for CTA sticky-ness Not Started [a]NV not mentioned, despite accounting for Â±$250M in annual revenue in 2025, planned $300M+ in 2026 [b]Original scope did not include NV, focusing on mealkits and RTE brands unification [c]@nikita.gorshkov@hellofresh.com how would this work for NV? You have completely different features in your conversion funnels and the reuse of the same components across all brands is part of this initiative [d]So, looking at the checkout features below, the majority of them are the same. While we have some additional features such as welcome kits and trial boxes, I think those can be built as additional components within Lego, no? [e]Of course they can be built but would need to be ready for us to launch lego as well as all differences in areas like Logistics and Fraud, for example. We've been testing for 6 months across HF and Factor and are still adding/fixing things because of all the custom logic, so this will not be an easy addition. But we can definitely assist your team in adopting Lego [f]@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com let's add the ticket in the Epic for the items which will need to be moved to Features still. _Assigned to anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com_ [g]@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com for our layout work we would need to build this one in too right? Did you consider it in the broken down tickets? _Assigned to anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com_ [h]@harneet.singh@hellofresh.com what is the status here? _Assigned to harneet.singh@hellofresh.com_ [i]US experiment is currently live. Rollout decision to be made mid-March [j]@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com to add a spike _Assigned to anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com_ ============================================================ ## EMAIL CONTENTS ============================================================ ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: Sunsetting Docker Desktop & Transition to Open Source Alternatives ID: 19b2cc6dd7570314 From: Lobo Olsson ---------------------------------------- [No readable text content found] ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: [Launch Announcement] Bob-to-Owl migration ID: 19b2cbd422d68a22 From: Shishir Mishra ---------------------------------------- [No readable text content found] ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: Declined: 1:1s: Jama-Nikita @ Thu Jan 1, 2026 5pm - 5:30pm (CET) (Nikita Gorshkov) ID: 19b2cb333d32ad09 From: Jama Musse ---------------------------------------- [No readable text content found] ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: Invitation: [Save the date] Q1 Staff Assembly @ Thu Feb 26, 2026 10:30am - 12pm (CET) (Nikita Gorshkov) ID: 19b2c78d95bfeb48 From: Beatriz Lanchas Fuentes ---------------------------------------- [No readable text content found] ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: Case HR-154366 is assigned to Julia Field. Their bones are so heavy they barely float, so instead of swimming, hippos do a slow-mo gallop along the riverbed like underwater tanks. They can even nap down there, automatically bobbing up for air before dropping back to sleep. **Whatâ€™s in store:** * AI comes to your **Kindle** * **Google** just made language barriers optional. * **Mindstream Picks: **Apple has released iOS 26.2. * Steal **[60 prompts](https://offers.hubspot.com/connector-prompts?utm_medium=email-media-newsletter&utm_source=mindstream&utm_campaign=owned&utm_term=2025-12-17&utm_content=native-ads)** from our vault! _Read Time: 5 minutes_ -------------------- ###### **AMAZON** ## [Amazonâ€™s new Kindle AI reads with you](https://www.theverge.com/news/844538/kindle-app-ask-this-book-ai-ios) View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/647f3b4d-18e9-472d-af29-48697269d013/mindstreammg_Create_a_digital_illustration_in_a_clean_modern__b3fe2d7d-4d58-48d9-b1d9-64148b00d9a9_1.png?t=1765813456) Follow image link: (https://www.theverge.com/news/844538/kindle-app-ask-this-book-ai-ios) Caption: Amazon has [added](https://www.theverge.com/news/844538/kindle-app-ask-this-book-ai-ios) a new AI feature to the Kindle app called Ask This Book. Max will walk through a workflow showing how product teams can: * Turn raw user behavior into clear â€œthis worked / this didnâ€™tâ€ signals * Compare versions without spinning up custom analysis * Learn faster without asking engineering for new instrumentation If youâ€™re trying to speed up how your team learns after every release, this session will be worth your time.
